recording.title: Blow the Man Down - Sea Shanty

song.comment: Alternate chorus lines after each verse line

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: To me, way hey, blow the man down Give me some time to blow the man down

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Come all ye young fellows that follows the sea Now please pay attention and listen to me

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: I'm a deep water sailor just come from Hong Kong You give me some whiskey, I'll sing you a song

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: When a trim Black Ball liner preparing for sea You'll split your sides laughing such sights you would see

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: There's tinkers and tailors, shoemakers and all They're all shipped for sailors aboard the Black Ball

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: When a big Black Ball liner's a-leaving her dock The boys and the girls on the pier-head do flock

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: Now, when the big liner, she's clear of land Our bosun he roars out the word of command

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: Come quickly, lay aft to the break of the poop Or I'll help you along with the toe of me boot

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: Pay attention to orders, now, you one and all For see high above there flies the Black Ball

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: 'Tis larboard and starboard, on deck you will sprawl For kicking Jack Rogers commands the Black Ball
